title.narrative: ADP Karamoja Cash for food Hum Response

description.narrative:
ADP: Project Title: Karamoja Cash for Food Project. Karamoja Region is known for laying in the dry belt of Uganda and the region received relatively lower rain which is poorly distributed. 2016 was no different as majority of the farmers registered cropfailure with little late harvest. According to World Food Program Mobile Vulnerability Analysis and Mapping 2017, only 15% of the household inthe region has food stock in November 2016, this food stock is anticipated to be depleted by March. Kotido district where the project will be implemented presents April to June as lean season in the region with high dependency on market and different coping strategy to meet the food need of the families in the region. By January 2017 there was increased debt burdenin Kotido 76% as families borrow to buy food. There was sale of food during the festive season and will have a negative impact on food stock. There is an escalation in food prices with Kotido registering 50% and this is anticipated to worsen by June 2017.Nakapelemoru sub-county will be targeted due to food crisis already being experienced in the community as communities are engaged in unsustainable coping strategies likesale of firewood, charcoal, casual labor. Provision of basic food to families constitute a critical step in saving lives by providing critically food insecure households with food ration required for healthy living. The food distribution will prevent hunger and its related effects like malnutrition, ill-health and poor coping strategywhich exposes communities to further emergencies in future.The timely food supply will ensure families be involve in production during the short rain and thus be able to provide own food in the remaining part of the year. This seed support will form an insurance to future production as the communities are supported during the lean person of April to June where the district always face critical food crisis.
ADP will use Participatory Rural AppraisalTools to engage the targeted communities to identifythefinal beneficiary. Using those tools will help in identification of familieswith community indicators of food crisis and names selected. The participation will help promote peace and special attention will be directed to women, child headed familiesandperson with disabilities in the eligibility criteria. Attention will be directed to households at greater risk due to limited coping strategy to become first beneficiary.

participating-org.narrative: Aridland Development Programme is a National Non-Governmental Organization found in 2008. The institution was formed by a Ugandan and he is managed by Board of Directors. The organisation have been responding to community needs in the area of Education, Food and Nutrition Security, Emergency Food Aid, Climate Resilience and Adaptation and Advocacy. Over the years the organization have gained confidence and partnered with more organization to provide these services. The major donors are Woord end Daad, Stroome Foundation and ICCO. The organization have over time developed operation policies and recruited qualified and competent staff and Board member. There are 54 staff of which 20 are female, there are 9 board member of which 5 are female depicting intentional appreciation of gender integration.
